tables

Class RecordTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • tables.RecordTable

  • public class RecordTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Record Table holds information regarding the TableView and CellInfo of the passed in state and table. The four types of RecordTables would be a Dance Table, Publication Table, Recording Table and Album Table. The columns are created based on a mapping from column name to field name of that specific Record. The state is one of "d", "p", "r" or "a" representing a Dance, Publication, Recording, or Album respectively. To change the columns of the Table, one must change colNameField mapping of column to field in the mapColumnNametoId() method as well as the fields of the Record class.

      RecordTable(Database db, SearchDataView sc, java.lang.String tableString, java.lang.String state)
      constructor for RecordTable creates a table of records according to either Dance, Publication, Recording, or Album.

      • RecordTable

        public RecordTable(Database db,
                   SearchDataView sc,
                   java.lang.String tableString,
                   java.lang.String state)
            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                   java.net.MalformedURLException
        constructor for RecordTable creates a table of records according to either Dance, Publication, Recording, or Album.
        Parameters:
        tableString - String of the desired table name of the schema. Should correspond with state.
        state - String that determines what type of RecordTable this should be. Should correspond with tableString.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.net.MalformedURLException

    • Method Detail

      • mapColumnNameToId

        public void mapColumnNameToId()
        returns the mapping of the class' state of column names in the TableView to field names of the Record according to the state. The first Column should refer to Name, the second to last should refer to I Have and the last column should refer to tag.

      • initializeTable

        public void initializeTable()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                            java.net.MalformedURLException
        sets up the initial table that holds all of the records. Columns are created according to the mapping and each record is added based on the a database query, getting all records according to the state
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.net.MalformedURLException
